pullRequest.body:
Some API for interactions between independence, closure and single-element insertions/differences in matroids. 

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [edfe7215c1](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15028/commits/edfe7215c178fa0abd3985a9abffb1f0145ae443)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Indep.closure_diff_singleton_ssubset`
`+ Indep.closure_diff_ssubset`
`+ Indep.closure_ssubset_closure`
`+ Indep.not_mem_closure_diff_of_mem`
`+ closure_diff_eq_self`
`+ closure_diff_singleton_eq_closure`
`+ closure_exchange`
`+ closure_exchange_iff`
`+ closure_insert_eq_closure_insert_of_mem`
`+ ext_closure`
`+ indep_iff_forall_closure_diff_ne`
`+ indep_iff_forall_closure_ssubset_of_ssubset`
`+ indep_iff_forall_not_mem_closure_diff`
`+ indep_iff_forall_not_mem_closure_diff'`
`+ mem_closure_diff_singleton_iff_closure`
`+ mem_closure_insert`
`+ subset_closure_diff_iff_closure_eq`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

</details>
I think there are a few more names where `forall` should come a bit earlier.
I think there are a few more names where `forall` should come a bit earlier.

I guess this could be a one-line proof using the more general lemma that if you remove a set `s` but `s \subset M.closure (X \ s)` then the closure doesn't change.

Do you think it's useful to have that lemma?

```suggestion
lemma indep_iff_forall_closure_diff_ne : M.Indep I   e  I,
```
Is it useful to generalize `{e}` to arbitrary nonempty sets?

```suggestion
    M.Indep I   J, J  I  M.closure J  M.closure I := by
```
Can you make `e` (and similar binders in the RHS of your new lemmas) semi-implicit? This is going to be useful when people use your lemmas in the forward direction.

pullRequest.title: feat(Data/Matroid/Closure): closure + insertion API
